items.position: Assistant Professor & Assistant Director of Community Outreach and Engagement
items.institution: Thomas Jefferson University, Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center, Department of Medical Oncology, Population Health Science Division
items.description: Leading research initiatives focused on health equity, cancer prevention, and community engagement. Developing partnerships with community organizations and mobile screening units to address cancer screening barriers in underserved populations. Current projects include reducing combustible smoking among formerly unhoused individuals in Philadelphia and promoting cancer screenings among individuals facing significant barriers to traditional healthcare settings. Also serving as Adjunct Instructor at Jefferson College of Population Health.

items.institution: University of Oklahoma, Health Promotion Research Center, Stephenson Cancer Center
items.description: Conducted research on smoking cessation interventions for socioeconomically disadvantaged populations and refugee health under Dr. Darla Kendzor.

items.institution: Stanford University, Muslim Mental Health and Islamic Psychology Lab
items.description: Contributing to suicide prevention initiatives and mental health research in Muslim communities under Dr. Rania Awaad.

items.institution: George Mason University, Department of Global and Community Health
items.description: Taught GCH626: Migrant Health, focusing on health challenges and interventions for migrant and refugee populations.

items.institution: University of Maryland, Counseling Center Research Unit & School of Public Health
items.description: Conducted research on mental health, substance use, and health behaviors in diverse populations. Served as Principal Investigator for dissertation project and instructor for HLTH 106/H: Drug Use and Abuse.
